description:
Seen here:

http://logs.openstack.org/08/283708/3/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-full-ceph/094fc27/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz?level=TRACE

Shows up quite a big:

http://logstash.openstack.org/#dashboard/file/logstash.json?query=message%3A%5C%22Trying%20to%20apply%20a%20migration%20context%20that%20does%20not%20seem%20to%20be%20set%20for%20this%20instance%5C%22%20AND%20tags%3A%5C%22screen-n-cpu.txt%5C%22&from=7d

Already changed from warning to debug on master: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/229792/
title: 'Trying to apply a migration context that does not seem to be set for this instance' spams n-cpu logs in liberty

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: stable/liberty
Review: https://review.openstack.org/284761
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/284761
Committed: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/commit/?id=0382cb89107a0982435cd7ee7d2cd338ad6ee0d6
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    stable/liberty

commit 0382cb89107a0982435cd7ee7d2cd338ad6ee0d6
Author: Nikola Dipanov <email address hidden>
Date:   Thu Oct 1 10:23:45 2015 +0100

    Change warn to debug logs when migration context is missing
    
    MigrationContext record missing is currently a regular situation. There
    will be no migration record at all (and thus no MigrationContext record)
    in case of a rebuild on the same host, and in case of evacuate request,
    which explicitly specifies the target host.
    
    With this in mind we demote the log messages that point out the missing
    migration context to debug.
    
    Closes-Bug: #1549853
    
    Change-Id: I96b6c859a9d450707f997e43e37f770e2a9dea7a
    (cherry picked from commit b70f4320a296bf7111d276bef5e92c289fe5fa8f)
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content: This issue was fixed in the openstack/nova 12.0.2 release.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~doug-hellmann
